intro: Pyrenacantha perrieri, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers. The plant has small, leathery leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pyrenacantha perrieri is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
